answers.answer: Hi-was she checked for diabetes. Other than vomiting a lot of her symptoms are similar. Good luck and make sure she drinks plenty od fluids to prevent dehydrationKaren

If you can rule out the possibility of it being a virus, then most likely her symptoms stems from a food allergy.  Most young children are allergic to cow's milk.  If this is the case, then stay away from soy milk as the molecular makeup of soy protein is similar to cow's milk.  I would reccommend staying away from the high allergic foods such as dairy, eggs, nuts, fish, and soy.  Blessings

question: For the past 10 days my daughter has been vomitng @ about 2:30am.  She does not have a history of acid reflux, but the doctor seems to think this is the problem.  She is only doing it at night and the food is totally undigested, she is eating dinner @ 5 and throwing up 8 hours later. She is constantly hungry and seems to not be gaining weight for the amount of food she is eating she should be gaining weight?  I stared her on the previcid and she went one night w/out vomiting but tonight she did it again, and she seems to feel fine after doing it.  She goes to bed w/ no problem and then lets out a cry before she does it and then wants to run around and play?  I am at a loss and grealty concerned as to what is happening. The doctor check for a bladder infection, did blood tests for liver, kidney, gastroitis etc and it all came back normal?  Could he be missing something?
title: Toddler Vomiting for no reason?
